replies.author: kaikalur

timeline.bodyText: Is this change necessary? I failed to spot logical difference between the two 😂
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText:
First off, this whole class should not even exist. There should be one and only one way to execute stuff for correctness guarantees - we will eventually get there.
That said, if the condition constant folds, then you need to evaluate only one of the branches. Both correctness and minor perf in planning time.
replies.author: kaikalur

timeline.bodyText: Remove "So that better code is generated especially for tableau queries", this is very specific to our workload and quite confusing for general community.
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: No. Tableau is a popular tool and the problem is general for any Presto user.
replies.author: kaikalur

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to change this? Would this not trigger bytecode too large anymore?
timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: So the code now stack overflows in the bytecode generator. So part2 of this change will also fix that.
replies.author: kaikalur

timeline.author: rongrong

replies.bodyText: Removed the comment to follow the "no comments" style :)
